block.p: Cornelia Hartley Kahn and Robert Theobald Cassady III were married yesterday at the Winnetka Congregational Church in Winnetka, Ill. The Rev. Joseph Shank performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Cassady, 32, is known as Hartley. She is the marketing manager for new products at Frederic Fekkai & Company, the hair and skin-care company in New York. She graduated cum laude from Colgate University and received an M.B.A. from Duke University.
Cornelia Hartley Kahn and Robert Theobald Cassady III were married yesterday at the Winnetka Congregational Church in Winnetka, Ill. The Rev. Joseph Shank performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Cassady, 32, is known as Hartley. She is the marketing manager for new products at Frederic Fekkai & Company, the hair and skin-care company in New York. She graduated cum laude from Colgate University and received an M.B.A. from Duke University.

The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Kahn of Winnetka. Her father is a managing partner in the Chicago office of Heidrick & Struggles, the executive search firm. Her mother, Gail Kahn, is a specialist in American decorative arts and was until earlier this year the chairwoman of the dealers' committee for the Winnetka Antiques Show.

Mr. Cassady, 35, works in Salt Lake City for Goldman, Sachs & Company, the investment bank. He is a project manager on Goldman.com, a wealth-management Web site the bank is developing. He graduated from the United States Naval Academy, where he later worked as a naval science and navigation instructor. His parents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert Cassady Jr., live in Chestertown, Md., where the bridegroom's father is an industrial skills consultant.
